name: Windows UI
description:
The Windows UI Toolkit is a resource for creating experiences on Windows. It contains a control library and examples of how those controls are used within the WinUI platform.


This toolkit represents the latest version of Windows UI, version 2.7. You can find information about this release at this link.


FAQs

  • Looking for fonts? Download Segoe UI Variable and Segoe Fluent Icons fonts from this link.
  • Found a bug? File it here.


What’s new in version 2.7 (4.29.22):

  • Refactor: Auto layout added to Context menu, Command Bar Flyout, Expander, Toggle Split Button, Split Button, Toggle Switch, Checkbox, Radio Button, Rating.
  • Style: Textbox now has focus with header states.
  • Bug fixes


What’s new in version 2.7 (3.25.22):


  • Added 24 hour variant to the Time Picker component.
  • New light dismiss property on Teaching Tip base element. Variants without light dismiss should not use acrylic material.
  • Updated corner radius on List View and Tree View to the correct 4px radius.
  • Pressed states for caret icon scales correctly.


What’s new in version 2.7 (2.28.22):

 

  • Added Contrast Themes to Styles and Guidance & Charts.
  • Added Windows Animation Values to Guidance & Charts.
  • Added Device Screen Size documentation to Guidance & Charts
  • Added three button layout to Content Dialog
  • Bug fixes


What’s new in version 2.7 (11.16.21):


  • Combo Box: auto layout added
  • Dialog: single button variant added
  • Bug fixes


What’s new in version 2.7 (09.10.21):


  • Color Picker: added Horizontal layout
  • Badge (InfoBadge): new control published
  • Teaching Tip: added more tail positions
  • Bug fixes
